alert.note: Alert for Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued January 11 at 9:03AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Forest Service Bridger Teton Avalanche Center in Jackson has ISSUED an AVALANCHE WATCH which is in effect until 5 AM MST Friday... * WHAT...Avalanche watch. The avalanche danger is expected to rise to HIGH tomorrow. Strong winds and heavy snow falling on weak layers in the snowpack will create widespread areas of unstable snow. Backcountry avalanche conditions are dangerous today and will become even more dangerous over the weekend. * WHERE...Big Hole mountains and Caribou Range of Southeast Idaho. * WHEN...until 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Natural and human-triggered avalanches large enough to bury people are almost certain to occur. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Very dangerous avalanche conditions will exist beginning Friday. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Stay off of and out from below steep slopes -- slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. Avalanches may be triggered remotely -- from flat terrain above, below, and to the sides of steep slopes. Natural and human-triggered avalanches may run long distances and may impact gentler terrain below. Consult www.jhavalanche.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
